result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Danek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.
Consecutive to: sentence in 21CF436, and any other sentence.

--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443, plus $43 in subpoena fees, The Court grants the Defendant 90 days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in entry of a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Certify Debt to the WI Dept. of Revenue.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua J Danek
Current: PO Box 601, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 08-12-2022)
Prior: 200 E. Truman #104, Jefferson, WI 53549

[ma] Cases 20CM221, 21CF436, 22CF228 called at 11:13am
Defendant Joshua J Danek in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Joshua J Danek.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing & Arraignment occurs in Case 22CF228:
Mr. Danek waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #2 of Case 21CF436, Count #3 of Case 21CF436, Count #2 of Case 22CF228; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: 20CM221, remaining Counts in 22CF228 & 21CF436, and uncharged DA Case #22JE1080, DOV: 4/7/22, Referred Charges: Misdemeanor Bail Jump & CCW.

Sentencing arguments/recommendations given by Counsel
Statement made by Defendant

On Count #2 of Case 21CF436, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 20  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on 7/30/22 at 8:00pm
--1 day credit for time already served given
--Mr. Danek is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443, The Court grants the Defendant 90 days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in entry of a civil judgment. 
The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

On Count #3 of Case 21CF436, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, concurrent to sentence in Count #2 of Case 21CF436
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Danek is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge, plus $25 in drug testing fees = $468, The Court grants the Defendant 90 days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in entry of a civil judgment. 
The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

On Count #2 of Case 22CF228, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 10  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive to sentence in 21CF436, and any other sentence. 
--3 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Danek is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443, plus $43 in subpoena fees, The Court grants the Defendant 90 days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in entry of a civil judgment. 
The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.
recess: 11:50am

--Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
